class_notes:
Content: Readings in American literature from the Civil War to the present. By the end of the course, students should have a good sense of the movements, writers, and ideas shaping American literature from 1865 to the 21st century. Lecture, discussion, in-class writing and exams; individual and small group tutorials.  See Canvas for full description. 
NOTE:  You will encounter offensive language (racist, sexist, classist language including obscenities) and ideas as well as graphic scenes of violence in our reading material. 
Texts: We will read 5-7 texts as a group; students will construct  individualized reading lists based on interests. No electronics may be used in class. You will need print copies of the texts in order to complete in-class work. There are various ways to access those, see Canvas for more detail. 
Work: 3 tests (15% each); writing assignments, some requiring research (35%); attendance (mandatory): 10%; participation (10%). All work must be completed to pass the course.
course_description: Readings in American literature from 1865 to the present, with attention to cultural and historical backgrounds.
sections: Class Nbr: 2121, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: B. Ladd, Status: Open
